headline.seo: Scientists Ask, ‘Are Airplanes Safe for Overweight Passengers?’
headline.main: Questioning Safety of Heavy Passengers on Planes

docs.abstract: Some engineers and scientists question whether airplane seats, tested with crash-test dummies that reflect the old 170-pound passenger weight rule, are strong enough to protect heavy travelers; average American man weighs nearly 194 pounds and the average women 165.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some scientists are asking whether airplane seat regulations — written for Americans of an earlier era — are strong enough to protect today’s heavier travelers.
docs.snippet: Some scientists are asking whether airplane seat regulations — written for Americans of an earlier era — are strong enough to protect today’s heavier travelers.

keywords.value: National Assn to Advance Fat Acceptance
keywords.name: organizations
